attributes.action: Allow the Jury in the Menezes case to make their own verdict without interference from the Government, Home Office or Coronor
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: For the past few weeks the Jury have sat and listened to evidence on the killing of Mr Menezes, only to be told they must not find a 'unlawful killing'. What is the point of having an inquest when the decision appears to have already been made? The tax payer has payed for this inquest and therefore the public should be allowed to make their own minds up without political interference.

rejection.details: Please supply full name and address information.Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: False or incomplete name or address information
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
